intro: Sanchezia ovata, commonly known as the oval leaf sterculia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its flowers are typically pale green to yellowish and are clustered in inflorescences. Sanchezia ovata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
